body: @yegor256 please, pay attention to this issue

Job [#1306](https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/issues/1306) is now in scope, role is `DEV`

<!-- https://www.0crat.com/footprint/C9R53K5JA/921137512, version: 1.0-SNAPSHOT, hash: 3e63daab -->

The job [#1306](https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/issues/1306) assigned to @llorllale[/z](https://www.0crat.com/u/llorllale), here is [why](https://www.0crat.com/footprint/C9R53K5JA/932132732); the budget is 30 minutes, see [ยง4](http://www.zerocracy.com/policy.html#4); please, read [ยง8](http://www.zerocracy.com/policy.html#8) and [ยง9](http://www.zerocracy.com/policy.html#9); if the task is not clear, read [this](http://www.yegor256.com/2015/02/16/it-is-not-a-school.html) and [this](http://www.yegor256.com/2015/01/15/how-to-cut-corners.html)

<!-- https://www.0crat.com/footprint/C9R53K5JA/932132750, version: 1.0-SNAPSHOT, hash: 8699e2ef -->

@amihaiemil some advice please:

This task is simple and thus within 12 minutes I've already modified 8 files. Is it already too much?

@llorllale I would leave a puzzle to modify the others in a future task. I see it as follows:

It's better if a project pays you more than you worked, in some tasks like this one, than risk to introduce bugs, that are very hard to track, since they will eventually find a PR with 50 changed files.

@amihaiemil I'll leave it at 8 files then. 

As a rule of thumb, what's the max number of changed files for a PR for you (ideally)?

issue.body:
The puzzle `1306-59643c80` from #1306 has to be resolved:

https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/blob/cf3c5acb8a87c549250735e64398ff219237b198/src/test/java/com/jcabi/github/RtGistCommentTest.java#L57-L59

The puzzle was created by rultor on 05-Apr-18. 

Estimate: 30 minutes, role: DEV.

If you have any technical questions, don't ask me, submit new tickets instead. The task will be "done" when the problem is fixed and the text of the puzzle is _removed_ from the source code. Here is more about [PDD](http://www.yegor256.com/2009/03/04/pdd.html) and [about me](http://www.yegor256.com/2017/04/05/pdd-in-action.html).
